name: Avoid using web service calls inside a loop
description: When designing web service to get/post/put/delete data, you want to make sure that you minimize the number of calls between the client application and web service server. This rule will check the official Angular syntax http/httpclient to do call to web service. This rule is compliant with CISQ OMG recommendation ASCPEM-PRF-08.
output:
Line and column for each violation
Associated value => number of violations found
rationale: When designing web service to get/put/post/delete data, you want to make sure to minimize the number of calls between the client application and web service server. By minimizing the number of calls, you improve application speed, reduce communications overhead and reduce network traffic.
remediation: Try to create a process queue that will manage all the requests with a limited number of concurrents requests. When a request callback has been managed /executed, a new request could be fired.

qualityStandards.name: Resource-consuming operation in loop
qualityStandards.description: Remove instances where an operation causing consumption of platform resource (messaging, lock, file, stream, directory, etc.) is directly or indirectly called within a loop body or within a loop condition
